newsitem.title: INDIA: India says to release GDP forecasts every quarter.
newsitem.headline: India says to release GDP forecasts every quarter.

text.p: Indian Planning Minister Yogendra Alagh said on Wednesday the government's Central Statistical Organisation will begin releasing estimates of gross domestic product every quarter from next January.
The Indian government currently releases provisional, quick and final forecasts of GDP, but not at regular intervals.
"We have decided to join a global group in which we will give electronic information on short-term trends in the economy," Alagh told a business seminar.
The figures would be provided to the International Monetary Fund for a data survey of 33 countries, Alagh later told Reuters. But the figures will be first released in New Delhi.
